Posted By: Phantom_of_the_FNM (4/14/2011 10:09:57 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The original intent of this kind of serves as a precursor to the dredge mechanic.  
1. Find some spirits and stick em in your yard.  
2. Soulshift something big to get any of one of those spirits back  
3. ???  
4. Profit!  
  
But the coolest thing to do with this, as has been said is a [Living End](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Living End) deck.  
[Patriarch's Bidding](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Patriarch's Bidding), [Twilight's Call](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twilight's Call), and [Balthor the Defiled](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Balthor the Defiled) also work.
posts.html:
The original intent of this kind of serves as a precursor to the dredge mechanic.
1. Find some spirits and stick em in your yard.
2. Soulshift something big to get any of one of those spirits back
3. ???
4. Profit!

But the coolest thing to do with this, as has been said is a Living End deck.
Patriarch's Bidding, Twilight's Call, and Balthor the Defiled also work.

posts.post_content:
It is a shadow, the true self.  
  
It's one of those Shadows from Persona 4, born from the repressed emotions of [Iname, Life Aspect](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Iname, Life Aspect). Because he refused to accept his selfishness and desire to keep his Child forever, Iname, Death Aspect remained loose upon the world, until whatever caused [Iname as One](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Iname as One) to happen.
posts.html:
It is a shadow, the true self.

It's one of those Shadows from Persona 4, born from the repressed emotions of Iname, Life Aspect. Because he refused to accept his selfishness and desire to keep his Child forever, Iname, Death Aspect remained loose upon the world, until whatever caused Iname as One to happen.
